revised_title: Investigation of the Quaternary System Aluminium-Iron-Cobalt-Nickel
tldr: The authors investigated the quaternary system of aluminium-iron-cobalt-nickel, focusing on the role of transition metals in alloys. They found that the inter-metallic compounds formed by aluminium and transition metals can be considered electron compounds, with transitional metal atoms absorbing electrons. The study confirms previous suggestions that the theory of transition metals in aluminium alloys can be used to predict the forms of complex equilibrium diagrams.
